intro: Maba lancea, commonly known as the lanceleaf maba, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and distinctive flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. The tree can reach heights of up to 20 meters and has a straight trunk with smooth, greyish bark.
